title: Da Afghanistan Bank
text:
(DAB, ; ) is the <a href="central%20bank">central bank</a> of <a href="Afghanistan">Afghanistan</a>. It regulates all <a href="banking">banking</a> and money handling operations in Afghanistan. The bank currently has 46 branches throughout the country, with five of these situated in <a href="Kabul">Kabul</a>, where the headquarters is also based.
Da Afghanistan Bank is a wholly <a href="State%20ownership">government-owned</a> bank, established in 1939. DAB is active in developing policies to promote <a href="financial%20inclusion">financial inclusion</a> and a member of the <a href="Alliance%20for%20Financial%20Inclusion">Alliance for Financial Inclusion</a>. In May 2020, the bank launched a campaign to promote the use of <a href="Afghan%20afghani">Afghan currency</a> instead of <a href="Iranian%20rial">Iranian rials</a> in the western provinces.
Bank's seal.
The seal of Da Afghanistan Bank has the name of the bank in <a href="Pashto">Pashto</a> at the top and <a href="Latin%20script">Latin script</a> at the bottom, the year 1939 in which it was established, and a depiction of a <a href="Eucratides%20I">Eucratides I</a>-era coin with the <a href="Greek%20language">Greek</a> text, "" which means "Of the great king Eucratides".
